i think learning syntax only will be boring somehow and you will not learn a lot if you didn't apply what you are learning (on a project or some tasks). You'd better do both simultaneously (C++ syntax in parallel with algorithms). Data structures and algorithms always go together because data structures are helpful in the way algorithms are applied on them.

C++ is not about OOP, but about generic and template programming. Learning STL and C++17 is a good way to start.
Don't use video courses to learn a programming language. Read a book.

Algorithms,  and design patterns , and C++ are different topics. You can find whole books focusing on each one.
Once you are familiar with C++ syntax and basic features: go a head with learning more about OOP, STL and templates.

I would recommend the following two books:
**C++ Primer:for learning C++ features, STL, and memory managment.
** Data Structures and Algorithms analysis in c++:for  algorithm and data structure analysis and implementation in C++.

My recommendation is to use the following books:
- C++ Primer (https://www.amazon.com/Primer-5th-Stanley-B-Lippman/dp/0321714113/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1467916865&sr=1-1&keywords=c%2B%2Bprimer)

----- Chapters:1 -5 covers the basics.
------ Chapters 7, 13, 14, 15: (You learn about OOP) 
----- Chapters 9, 10, 11, 17 :covers C++ library, STL and templates.
----- Chapter  12:  will learn you about dynamic memory managment and smart pointers.
--- At the end of the book there is also a good summary of new features in C++11.

But if you are looking for an algorithms book, that focuses on implementing algorithms in C++, then I would recommend:
Data Structures & Algorithm Analysis in C++
https://www.amazon.com/Data-Structures-Algorithm-Analysis-C/dp/013284737X
